benchmark_details.name: AmbigBio
benchmark_details.overview: AmbigBio is a new dataset developed for evaluating the factuality of long-form generations by large language models, particularly focusing on names with entity ambiguity, where each name corresponds to multiple entities in Wikipedia.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the factuality of long-form generations from large language models by focusing on entity ambiguity.

data.source: 500 ambiguous names collected from Wikipedia disambiguation pages.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by humans for evaluating factuality.

methodology.calculation: D-FActScore is calculated by grouping atomic facts and verifying them against the best-matching Wikipedia entity.
methodology.interpretation: A lower D-FActScore indicates a higher likelihood of mixing facts of different entities, thus being non-factual.
methodology.validation: Human evaluation correlates with automatic evaluations for validating D-FActScore.
